mosinstall.description:
Ninja Secret Panel V.1.0




© Copyright 2007 Richie Mortimer and Daniel Chapman. Ninjoomla.com. All rights reserved.

This module allows you to place a hidden panel where you can display modules such as a login or contact form.
The module incorporates the mootools Javascript Library (v. 1.11).



Usage Instructions:

You need to create a new module position named secret and then put any modules you wish to hide in this new module position.

Changelog and features:
V 1.0 : Initial Version
  • Can be CSS or JavaScript Driven
  • If JavaScript is turned off it will degrade gracefully to the CSS display
  • Display features can be customised between clicking and mouseover/out for opening and/or closing.

param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (table.moduletable), this allows individual module styling. You will want this to be -flush in most instances to give the menu freedom to move.

param.name: inc_js
param.label: Display Method
param.description: Use Javascript or only CSS to display the panel.

param.name: open_meth
param.label: Open Method
param.description: Which method do you want the panel to be opened by?

param.name: close_meth
param.label: Close Method
param.description: Which method do you want the panel to be closed by? Mouseout requires the panel to be hidden via css only and thus without the fade effect. Please note that due to browser limitations, any user with the IE6 browser will always see the close button, and cannot use mouseout.

param.name: ninsecret_name
param.label: Panel Trigger Text
param.description: The text displayed on the page which the user moves their mouse over to trigger the secret panel display

param.name: ninsecret_text
param.label: Panel Trigger Color
param.description: Text Color in hex format, eg. #000000,#CCCCCC

param.name: ninsecret_hover
param.label: Trigger Text Hover Color
param.description: The colour of the trigger text when the user has their mouse over it - hex format, eg. #000000,#CCCCCC

param.name: ninsecret_panelwidth
param.label: Panel Trigger Width
param.description: The width of the secret panel trigger, not the panel iself.

param.name: ninsecret_paneltop
param.label: Panel Top Margin
param.description: Used to position the Trigger panel. Negative margins are ok.

param.name: ninsecret_panelleft
param.label: Panel Left Margin
param.description: Used to position the Trigger panel. Negative margins are ok.

param.name: ninsecret_paneltopie6
param.label: Panel Top Margin - IE6
param.description: Used to position the Trigger panel. Negative margins are ok. IE6 is such a hunk of junk that it has a broken way of measuring margins so it may require IE6 specific margins. Left these empty to use the same as above.

param.name: ninsecret_panellefti6e
param.label: Panel Left Margin - IE6
param.description: Used to position the Trigger panel. Negative margins are ok. IE6 is such a hunk of junk that it has a broken way of measuring margins so it may require IE6 specific margins. Left these empty to use the same as above.

param.name: ninsecret_background
param.label: Box Background Color
param.description: Box Background Color - hex format, eg. #000000,#CCCCCC

param.name: ninsecret_zindex
param.label: Box Z-index
param.description: The Z-index of your box. This is used to make it appear on top of other elements.

param.name: ninsecret_boxtext
param.label: Box text Color
param.description: Color of the text inside the box (leave blank to let the template determine the color) - hex format, eg. #000000,#CCCCCC

param.name: ninsecret_boxpos
param.label: Box Position
param.description: Whether the hidden box should be to the left or the right of the trigger panel.
